content.prompt: The power of the Russian prime minister is more limited than the power of the prime minister in the United Kingdom because

choices.label: only in the United Kingdom does the prime minister act as head of government
the Russian prime minister is limited by a much more powerful head of state
the parliament in the United Kingdom has the power to pass laws, whereas the Russian parliament does not
the United Kingdom has an unwritten constitution, whereas Russia has a written constitution

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the implications of the similarities and differences between countries with different political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
